author: Marilee Turscak - MSFT
message: Update ID Protection guide for risk analysis

ai_summary.Messages:
{"role":"user","content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: {
  "sha": "24e58933fc9e97e58e9231bbcb5ae137d7bb4b45",
  "filename": "docs/architecture/id-protection-guide-analyze.md",
  "status": "modified",
  "additions": 2,
  "deletions": 1,
  "changes": 3,
  "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/bb56408ece59e75117f7fa3a68840ab3acc2f9db/docs%2Farchitecture%2Fid-protection-guide-analyze.md",
  "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/bb56408ece59e75117f7fa3a68840ab3acc2f9db/docs%2Farchitecture%2Fid-protection-guide-analyze.md",
  "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Farchitecture%2Fid-protection-guide-analyze.md?ref=bb56408ece59e75117f7fa3a68840ab3acc2f9db",
  "patch": "@@ -119,7 +119,7 @@ AADUserRiskEvents\n | summarize count()by UserDisplayName \r\n ```\r\n \r\n-Use the previous query to identify common user patterns, such as service accounts, or small user subsets generating large amounts of risk. In the following screenshot, there are risky users. One generates more risk events than the others. For this scenario, you can block the user, or require a secure password change. \r\n+Use the previous query to identify common user patterns, such as service accounts, or small user subsets generating large amounts of risk. In the example screenshot, one user accounts for significantly more risk events than others. If a single user is responsible for a disproportionate amount of risk in your tenant, we recommend requiring a secure password change.\r\n \r\n    ![Screenshot of risky user data from the query.](./media/id-protection-guide-analyze/risky-users.png)\r\n \r\n@@ -262,5 +262,6 @@ To get started, explore the Azure Monitor log reference tables for Microsoft Ent\n \r\n \r\n \r\n+\r\n \r\n \r"
}. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response: The changes clarify advice for analysing user risk events. The updated text suggests requiring a secure password change as a recommended action when a single user accounts for a disproportionate amount of risk, replacing the more general advice of blocking the user or requiring a password change.
